OCType

Defines the core types and functions for the OCTypes library.

This file contains the fundamental type definitions, including OCTypeID, OCIndex, and the base OCTypeRef, as well as functions for type registration, memory management (retain/release), and basic type introspection.

struct __OCBase
#include <OCType.h>

The fundamental base structure for all OCTypes.

This structure is embedded as the first member in all OCType-compatible objects. It holds common information like the type identifier, retain count, and function pointers for essential operations.

Public Members

OCTypeID typeID

The type identifier for this object.

uint32_t retainCount

The retain count for this object.

void (*finalize)(const void*)

Function pointer for finalizing (deallocating) the object.

bool (*equal)(const void*, const void*)

Function pointer for comparing objects for equality.

OCStringRef (*copyFormattingDesc)(OCTypeRef cf)

Function pointer for creating a formatted string description.

group OCType

Core type definitions and memory management functions.

Defines

IF_NO_OBJECT_EXISTS_RETURN(OBJECT, X)

Macro to check if an object is NULL and return a specified value if it is.

Parameters:

  • OBJECT – The object to check.

  • X – The value to return if OBJECT is NULL.

Typedefs

typedef uint32_t OCTypeID

Defines an identifier for an OCType.

typedef int32_t OCIndex

Defines an index type, typically used for array or collection indexing.

typedef struct __OCType *OCTypeRef

A reference to an opaque OCType structure. This is the base type for all objects in the OCTypes system.

typedef const struct __OCString *OCStringRef

A reference to an immutable OCString instance.

typedef struct __OCBase OCBase

The fundamental base structure for all OCTypes.

This structure is embedded as the first member in all OCType-compatible objects. It holds common information like the type identifier, retain count, and function pointers for essential operations.

Enums

enum CommonConstants

Defines common constant values.

Values:

enumerator kOCNotFound

Represents a value not found, typically used as a return value from search functions.

enum SpecialTypeIDs

Defines special type ID values.

Values:

enumerator _kOCNotATypeID

Represents an invalid or uninitialized OCTypeID.

Functions

bool OCTypeEqual(const void *theType1, const void *theType2)

Compares two OCType instances for equality.

Parameters:

  • theType1 – A pointer to the first OCType instance.

  • theType2 – A pointer to the second OCType instance.

Returns:

True if the types are considered equal, false otherwise.

OCTypeID OCRegisterType(char *typeName)

Registers a new OCType with the system.

Parameters:

  • typeName – A string representing the name of the type to register.

Returns:

The OCTypeID assigned to the newly registered type. Returns _kOCNotATypeID if registration fails.

void OCRelease(const void *ptr)

Releases an OCType instance, decrementing its retain count.

Parameters:

  • ptr – A pointer to the OCType instance to release.

const void *OCRetain(const void *ptr)

Retains an OCType instance, incrementing its retain count.

Parameters:

  • ptr – A pointer to the OCType instance to retain.

Returns:

A pointer to the retained OCType instance (the same as ptr), or NULL if ptr is NULL.

OCStringRef OCTypeCopyFormattingDesc(const void *ptr)

Creates a string representation of an OCType instance suitable for formatting.

Parameters:

  • ptr – A pointer to the OCType instance.

Returns:

An OCStringRef containing the formatted description. Returns NULL if ptr is NULL.

OCStringRef OCCopyDescription(const void *ptr)

Creates a descriptive string representation of an OCType instance.

Parameters:

  • ptr – A pointer to the OCType instance.

Returns:

An OCStringRef containing the description. Returns NULL if ptr is NULL.

OCTypeID OCGetTypeID(const void *ptr)

Gets the OCTypeID of an OCType instance.

Parameters:

  • ptr – A pointer to the OCType instance.

Returns:

The OCTypeID of the instance, or _kOCNotATypeID if ptr is NULL.

struct __OCBase
#include <OCType.h>

The fundamental base structure for all OCTypes.

This structure is embedded as the first member in all OCType-compatible objects. It holds common information like the type identifier, retain count, and function pointers for essential operations.
